ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got a good base knowledge of Spanish and learned vocabulary related to traveling, weekends, food, culture, and weather. I also learned the present tense and preterite.
This course taught me the basics of Spanish and provided me with a space to practice speaking and listening.
I feel so confident about all that I learned. Learning Spanish was not easy but I feel so good.
I began to learn the Spanish language and learned a bit about cultures of different spanish speaking countries.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: engaging, good way to bond with classmates, fun, you learn a lot given the everyday schedule, professor is great
Weaknesses: class sizes can end up being big since Spanish is such a popular language, hard to get speaking practice
definitely a lot of work, but honestly, forces you to learn material
It is fast paced and has a lot of homework. It's not easy but you have to push yourself through it.
I think Professor Vazquez does a great job teaching this course. I feel as if I had greatest benefit from our in class discussions, forcing me to think on my feet in spanish.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course. I took it as a senior in spring semester because I have always wanted to learn the language, and I think that motivation helped my learning. The professor was great, and if you stay on top of your homework, then your grade will be good.
If you want to learn Spanish, then definitely
YES, I am so glad I took this course with Professor Maria Vasquez because she CARES about you and your learning.
Yes - spanish is a useful language, and Prof. Vazquez is an effective teacher. I would recommend this course to anyone considering starting a language.
